Description: Rim and shoulder sherd of large Corinthian, probably black-figured, pottery column-krater; interior glazed black (partially preserved) with broad band in added red at bottom of sherd; on top of rim stepped zigzag band; exterior of rim probably reserved; shoulder glazed; inscription on top of rim.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the decoration around the rim, see Boston 86.632.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p.120, no. A206)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 459)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.045) (Phase 1)
